== Point of view ==
  +
=== The Sunni point of view ===
[[Ahmad ibn Hanbal]], the great [[scholar]] of [[Sunni Islam]] (the Muslims who follow the Prophet [[Muhammad]]'s teachings), was one of the only scholars of his time to stand against this [[Fitnah]] (trial) of Islam and the Muslims. He was put under intense pressure, imprisoned, and tortured for sticking to the truth that the Qur'an was not created and that it was the literal words of Allah (God). He spent years in prison suffering patiently until he was finally released when the new [[Khalifa]] rejected the innovation of the Qur'an being created. Imam Ahmad ibn Hanbal is the reason Muslims today have the correct beliefs about the Qur'an and Allah's attributes.
